E P 0 R T .o * *The Cabinet Committee on the Optional Clause have carefully considered the Memorandum submitted by the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs to the Cabinet (Paper CP.,--192 (29)) and the remarks thereon of the First Lord of the Admiralty, the Secretary of State for War, the Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs, the Secretary of State for India and the Lord President of the Council, as well as the views of the Dominions and India. They submit the following conclusions for the approval of" the Cabinet:-(a) That the Optional Clause should be signed, the signature being accom--panied by the Declaration attached to this Report:(b) That the actual signature should take place during the next meeting of the Assembly of the League of Nations.The annexed Declaration is being communicated at once to the Dominions by the Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs, who has been asked bv the Committee to lay stress on the fact that the most careful consideration has been given to the views of the various Dominions and to express a strong hope that, in view of the importance of unanimity in this matter, they should concur in the proposed Declaration.2, Whitehall Gardens, s.W.1, (initialled)July 25, 1929, ...COPY No.CABINET.
